answers.answer: Hi there. Causes of numbness left arm may be fractures, nerve compression and nerve damage like diabetes and other peripheral neuropathies like infections, metabolic problems and toxin exposures. Other causes may be brachial plexus injury, ganglion cysts, raynaud’s disease, stroke, angina, alcoholism and vitamin B12 deficiency.Blepharospasm are of various types like benign essential blepharospasm is a blinking disorder of unknown cause. Other types may be associated with dry eyes, tourette’s syndrome, or other neurological problem. This usually starts with abnormal or excessive blinking along with general eye irritation. Early on the excessive blinking occurs only due to exposure to bright lights, being tired or under stress.You need to work out the possibilities with your neurologist and proceed further. Take care..

question: the last couple weeks my left eye has been twitching and my left arm has been going numb,why?
title: numbness and twitch
